definition: fate or chance that brings people together/predestined affinity or relationship/(Budd.) destiny

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: If chance, by lonely contemplation led.

sentences.english: What do you think of destine?
Guan often said there were some kind of foreordination between him and stones.
sentences.chinese: 关柏春常说自己和石头之间有一种缘分。

sentences.english: But the lottery of friendship could even depend on who we happen to meet first.
sentences.chinese: 但这种缘分甚至可能还取决于相识的先后顺序。

sentences.english: Why is knowing that fate has done, but also willing to love you?
sentences.chinese: 为何明知缘分已尽，还心甘情愿的爱着你？

sentences.english: It's over between us. I don't love you anymore.

sentences.english: Again there was certain amount of serendipity in it.
Really no easyly, is this a preordained relationship?

sentences.chinese: 恋爱婚姻，要看两个人的缘分。
缘分，其实是一种微妙的东西。

sentences.english: My special family background and women are destined to my life very decree by destiny.

sentences.english: So we are together again, and it must be fate.
sentences.chinese: 我们又在一起了，真是有缘分。

sentences.english: "Seven days ago, " he remarked, "I said I was going to leave you.
sentences.chinese: “七天之前，”他说，“我说我和大家的缘分尽了。

chance/opportunity/predestined relationship/(Buddhist) principal and secondary causes/chain of cause and effect
